translation: Hello, everyone!
transcript: 大家好！

translation: In such an era of the Internet, especially advanced mobile Internet, we can first look back into history when it comes to the future.
transcript: 在这个互联网，尤其是移动互联网非常发达的时代，我们在谈未来的时候，可以先看一下历史。

translation: This picture shows from about 2,000 ago to 200 years ago, how we human transported goods: through wooden boat, wheelbarrow, carriage or even camel.
transcript: 这张照片描述了大概从两千年以前到两百年以前，我们人类运送物资的方式：木船，独轮车，马车，甚至是骆驼。

translation: But now we use containers, airplanes, automobiles and even UAVs to send express deliveries and supplies to deal with problems in logistics.
transcript: 但是现在我已经是用集装箱，已经是用飞机，已经用汽车，甚至用无人机来运送我们的快递，运送我们的物资来解决我们的物流的问题。

translation: 2,000 years ago, horses were our "messengers".
transcript: 两千年以前，我们是用飞马传书的方式来传递信息。

translation: Until 200 years ago, telegram was invented to send and receive information.
transcript: 一直到两百年以前，我们发明了电报，以这种方式来传递信息。

translation: However, in the Internet Age, conveying information is such an easy thing through WeChat or mobile phones conveniently.
transcript: 但是在互联网时代，信息的传递方式已经是这样简单了，我们用我们的微信，用手机，非常便捷地来传递信息。

translation: Telegram office was a past thing.
transcript: 连电报局都已经消失掉了。

translation: About 2,000 years ago, roughly the Spring and Autumn Period and the Warring States Period, capital flew in such a way, called “knife money”.
transcript: 这是两千年以前大概是春秋战国的时候我们传递资金的方式，应该是还是刀币。

translation: So what are holes on them for?
transcript: 这上面的一个孔，这个孔是干什么用的嘞？

translation: Such “money” can be strung together, then tied to people’s waists.
transcript: 把所有这些货币把它穿在一起，然后绑在你的腰上。

translation: But now we can use Alipay or bank cards to realize capital flow.
transcript: 但是现在我们已已经是用支付宝，用刷卡，用这样的方式来实现我们资金的流动了。

translation: To be noted, Jack Ma, demonstrated in Hanover last month the new “Smile to Pay”.
transcript: 甚至于像马云，上个月在汉诺威他还演示了，他可以用刷脸的支付，来传递我们的资金。

translation: It occurs to me that whether it is possible to become Jack Ma through plastic surgery so that we could spend his money.
transcript: 我就在想我们是否可以整形成马云的样子就可以用他的钱啦。

translation: But personally, I don't want to spend his money at the price of becoming like him through plastic surgery.
transcript: 但是对我自己来想，我宁可不用他的钱我也不想整形他整成他的样子。

translation: This picture shows 2,000 years ago, the teaching method of Confucius.
transcript: 这是两千年以前我孔子教学的一个场景。

translation: Look, Confucius is behind the platform, and his 72 disciples are listening.
transcript: 你看，孔子在上面，他的72个门徒，在下面听他讲。

translation: 2,000 years later, in today’s Internet Age, it is a typical scene of school teaching.
transcript: 两千年后在互联网时代的今天，这是一个非常典型的，现在的，我们学校教学的一个模式。

translation: You will find that, in the financial industry, the way of information delivery, or logistics in recent decades or hundreds of years, has witnessed enormous changes comparing to that of 2,000 years ago.
transcript: 你会发现没有，在金融行业的传递方式，信息传递的方式，物流传递的方式，在最近的几百年几十年相比之于两千年以来发生巨大变化的时候。

translation: But only how we teach and convey knowledge seems to remain basically unchanged.
transcript: 唯有我们教学的方式，我们知识传递的方式，似乎没有那么大的变化。

translation: Why?
transcript: 为什么？

translation: Are our educators not innovative enough?
transcript: 难道是我们的教育行业的工作者们不够创新吗？

translation: I myself have engaged in the education industry for nearly 20 years.
transcript: 我自己在教育行业呆了将近二十年。

translation: Personally, the answer is “Yes” to a large extent.
transcript: 我觉得在很大程度上是的。

translation: Our education industry, or many of our educators, is really not bold enough to innovate.
transcript: 我们教育行业，我们很多的教育工作者，确实不够大胆创新。

translation: In the Internet age, we may pay for it.
transcript: 而在互联网时代我们可能会付出代价。

translation: At what expense?
transcript: 这是什么代价嘞？

translation: I think the price may be that universities will disappear in the near future, or universities in the traditional sense, will be completely transformed.
transcript: 我觉得这个代价可能就是，大学在不久的将来它可能会消失掉，或者说传统意义上的大学，它可能面临彻底被颠覆的危险。

translation: So what will teaching scenarios be in the era of mobile Internet?
transcript: 在移动互联网时代会是一个什么样的教学场景呢？

translation: In my opinion, the way in a designated time, at a designated space, to learn from the designated person on a designated topic will be no longer in existence.
transcript: 我觉得，在指定时间到一个指定空间，听指定的人讲指定的内容的教学方式，将会面临巨大的颠覆。

translation: Here are several circumstances.
transcript: 有这样几种场景。

translation: Firstly, more frequently, especially in IT industry I have been engaged in, students often surpass teachers.
transcript: 第一个，我发觉越来越多的现象，尤其在我从事的IT这个领域里面，学生经常超过了老师。

translation: Software or IT industry, will generally welcome a a new language every few months.
transcript: 我们这个软件行业也好，IT行业也好，一般来说每隔几个月可能就会产生一门新的语言。

translation: A diligent student can easily get access to the knowledge he needs through the Internet, mobile Internet and various digital tools.
transcript: 如果一个学生是非常勤奋的，他可以非常容易地获得他所需要的知识，通过互联网，通过移动互联网，通过各种电子的数字化的工具。

translation: Hence teachers and students in the campus have increasingly narrow gap actually.
transcript: 所以当一个老师和一个学生碰面在一起的时候啊，在大学校园里，老师与学生之间的界限其实是越来越小。

translation: A teacher who is not diligent enough will surely be surpassed by a diligent student, especially in the field of IT.
transcript: 如果一个老师不够勤奋，他很容易就被一个勤奋的学生所超越，特别是在IT这个领域。

translation: An academician with rich workshop experience rather than further study for 3 years cannot match a lecturer, and similarly, a lecturer without studying for 3 years is second to a student.
transcript: 一个院士如果他三年不学习他可能不如一个讲师，如果只是开会的话啊，一个讲师三年不学习，那他可能不如一个学生。

translation: More frequent cases have proved blurred boundaries between students and teachers.
transcript: 这已经是越来越频繁地在发生，就是学生和老师的界限变得模糊了。

translation: Another thing is that our diplomas or educational backgrounds are of less importance to employers or enterprises.
transcript: 另一个正在发生的事情，是我们的文凭或者我们的学历，在用人的单位，在企业里变得不太那么有用了。

translation: I remember when I started my own software company over a decade ago.
transcript: 我记得在十多年前我创业的时候。

translation: My technical director and backbone technicians were basically all graduates of famous universities such as Jiaotong University or Fudan University.
transcript: 我自己的软件公司里边，我的技术总监，我的技术骨干，基本上清一色的都是交大或者复旦或者这些名牌大学的学生。

translation: Almost all of them.
transcript: 几乎都是。

translation: Bur nowadays, in my own company or around me.
transcript: 但是十年之后的今天，我环顾四周一看，包括看一下我自己的企业。

translation: The fact is that technical leaders are not only schoolfellows of a few prestigious universities.
transcript: 我发觉越来越多的我的技术骨干、技术负责人已经不再是这几个名牌大学毕业的了。

translation: Instead, they may come from little known universities or even are not undergraduate students.
transcript: 他们很可能来自一个名不见经传的学校，甚至不见得是本科生。

translation: But they can still be responsible for very important posts and very difficult technical work.
transcript: 但是他们照样能够承担非常重要的岗位，照样能承担非常艰巨的技术的工作。

translation: This is the second thing happening around us.
transcript: 这是我们正在发生的第二个现象。

translation: Therefore, I wonder if universities will really disappear.
transcript: 所以我在想大学真的会消失吗？

translation: Is it highly necessary to have universities?
transcript: 大学是有那么大的必要存在吗？

translation: Comparing to department stores around us, I think universities actually follow a traditional B2C model, just like department stores at such as Nanjing Road and Huaihai Road.
transcript: 回头看一看我们周边的这些百货商店，我觉得大学其实是一种传统的B2C的模式，就像我们南京路、淮海路这些百货商店一样。

translation: Students pay to universities for knowledge conveyance service, and universities are much like a wholesaler who gather professors and lecturers together then “retail” to students.
transcript: 同学们到学院里面去花了钱，向学校购买知识传递的服务；学校呢就像一个批发商，把教授、讲师们批发到这里来再零售给学生。

translation: Exactly a traditional B2C model as I said.
transcript: 这是一个传统的B2C的模式。

translation: Last month, I was invited to give a speech at the Open University of Henan in Zhengzhou.
transcript: 我在上个月的时候，受邀请到郑州的开放大学去做过一次演讲。

translation: I remember that more than a decade ago, an advertisement always on CCTV said: “Where to enjoy shopping best? Asia in Zhengzhou is your best choice!”
transcript: 我记得我在十多年以前，听到有一个中央台里边总在做的广告，叫“中原购物何处去？郑州亚细亚。”

translation: “Asia” was the name of a huge shopping mall.
transcript: 就是个巨大的商场。

translation: After arriving at Zhengzhou, I asked “Is the shopping mall still there?”
transcript: 然后到了郑州我就问：“喔这个商场还在吗？”

translation: The answer was that “It didn’t exist a few years ago.”
transcript: 他说：“几年前就不存在了。”

translation: Similar cases actually happened for many times, and now malls are far more meaningful in terms of experience rather than shopping.
transcript: 同样的事情其实发生在很多类似的百货大商场里边，现在的商场更多的变成一种体验了。

translation: Friends in schools, job and daily life can go there out of unique atmosphere or stronger friendship.
transcript: 同同学们同志们兄弟们去商场里边，可能体会一下这里的环境，去交友。

translation: Exactly the same way of our colleges, especially business schools.
transcript: 你看也很像我们很多的学院啊，尤其是商学院。

translation: The glory of passing on knowledge now gradually makes way for diversified experience of even friendship or business matchmaking.
transcript: 它逐渐逐渐也把它的知识传递的功能变得不那么重要了，它也变成一种体验了，甚至是一种交友的体验，甚至是一种商业撮合的一种体验。

translation: Thus the way of conveying knowledge in the Internet Age will rely more on the means of the Internet and self-study.
transcript: 所以知识的传输的方式，在互联网时代，更多地将会依赖于网络的手段，依赖于我们自学的手段。

translation: Here is a hot topic in recent years, MOOC.
transcript: 这是一个，最近这几年很热的一个一个话题，就是MOOC，唉。

translation: As far as I know, an MIT professor who could only teach 400 students in class.
transcript: 我知道我们有一个MIT的教授，课堂里只能最多只能教四百个学生。

translation: In the last year, gave lessons to about 160,000 students through the Internet.
transcript: 但是到了去年，他通过网络的方式，他教了大概16万个学生。

translation: He pointed out different experience between online and offline lessons, with better results in a sense.
transcript: 他觉得这个网络上的教学和真实的教学会有完全不一样的体验，而且会有更好的效果，在某种意上。

translation: For example, traditionally, you should learn specified content in a given time, but it is not the rule through the Internet.
transcript: 比如说在指定的时间里你学指定的内容，而在这种网络的方式不需要。

translation: You can review or view the video when you have time, replay or even choose to watch any part of the content as you wish.
transcript: 你可以回看，可以在你方便的时间去看，哎你可以反复去看，甚至可以点播着看。

translation: Perhaps in some ways, it is not as detailed as face-to-face teaching.
transcript: 可能在某一些角度上面看，它不如我们面授那么详细.

translation: But its technical features can make up for the shortcomings we are not accustomed to.
transcript: 但是它的一些技术特点可以弥补我们暂时不习惯的缺陷。

translation: As a result, future higher education is more likely to realize through the Internet or other digital ways plus some forums and lectures.
transcript: 所以你看我觉得将来的大学教育会是一种通过互联网，通过我们数字化的方式来学习，加上一些讲坛、讲座这样形式的学习。

translation: If we interpret from the perspective of mobile web, it is actually a O2O learning model, namely, online plus offline learning.
transcript: 如果从移动互联网的角度来解读这个问题的话，它其实就是一种O2O的学习，线上的加上线下的学习。

translation: Assuming that a platform or any popular digital way that enables everyone to be a teacher and a learner.
transcript: 如果一个平台，如果我们习惯于通过数字化的方式每个人都可能成为老师，每个人都成为可能成为学生的话。

translation: Then such learning eventually evolves into a P2P model.
transcript: 那么这种学习甚至就会演变成一种P2P的模式的学习。

translation: The traditional B2C model will certainly be replaced by teaching models such as O2O and P2P little by little.
transcript: 传统的B2C的模式，肯定会逐渐被O2O的、P2P的、这样的一种教学的方式所取代。

translation: We also need to get used to such a process gradually.
transcript: 这个只是我们需要一个逐渐习惯的过程。

translation: I made some attempts on my own.
transcript: 我自己做了一些尝试。

translation: Early last year, as I served as a part-time professor at Shanghai Ocean University for several years.
transcript: 我在去年初的时候，因为我在上海的海洋大学跟他们做兼职教授做了好几年。

translation: I opened a course called “Introduction to Cloud Computing”.
transcript: 给他们开了一门课叫云计算概论。

translation: Then out of the idea of teaching through cloud computing,
transcript: 然后嘞我说我用云计算的方法来上这堂课。

translation: I developed a system since I started from software development.
transcript: 我自己就做了一套系统，因为我们是做软件出身的嘛。

translation: In this system, every question of and every click by students could be observed and recorded.
transcript: 在这套系统上面，学生的每一个问题，每一次点击都能被我观察和记录。

translation: More specifically, when did a student learn the course?
transcript: 学生他是什么时候学的？

translation: In which district of Shanghai?
transcript: 他是在上海哪个区学习的？

translation: During daytime or at night?
transcript: 他是白天学的还是晚上学的，还是下午学的？

translation: All the learning processes would be recorded and known by the teacher.
transcript: 他的每一个学习过程，都会被记录而且都会被老师所掌握。

translation: Here are some real-time data.
transcript: 这是我实况的一些数据。

translation: It occurs to me that, if talking about no necessity of universities is much of exaggeration, changing the role of diploma is an imminent issue.
transcript: 我就在想如果说大学的，我们谈到大学被颠覆，可能还有点危言耸听的话，那么文凭的颠覆就可能变得迫在眉睫。

translation: For what reasons?
transcript: 因为什么？

translation: Because as we collected immense data, just imaging, is diploma of great use to an HR?
transcript: 因为如果我有这么一个巨大的数据在，那么想象一下，对于一个HR来讲，我还需要那一纸文凭吗？

translation: Do you know how many universities are in China?
transcript: 我们中国有多少大学？

translation: According to my search, China has more than 2,000 universities and over 7 million graduates every year.
transcript: 我刚刚查了一下，我们有两千多所大学，每年有七百多万的毕业生。

translation: What’s this?
transcript: 这是什么？

translation: Twenty yuan, right?
transcript: 这是二十块钱。

translation: And what can I do with twenty yuan?
transcript: 二十块钱可以干什么？

translation: A lot of things.
transcript: 可以干很多事儿。

translation: However, I can tell you, it equals to the fee to register attendance on behalf of another student in universities.
transcript: 但是我告诉大家这二十块钱最近的行情是，在大学里边，请一个同学去签到的费用。

translation: It’s a standard level of charge.
transcript: 是标准费用。

translation: Twenty yuan means one registration.
transcript: 去点点一个卯，花二十块钱。

translation: Oh, it is weird and quite shocking to me.
transcript: 啊！我觉得这很很奇怪呀，而且让我很震撼！

translation: It reminds me more than 20 years ago, when I was studying at Jiaotong University, we presented a petition to school leaders.
transcript: 我我想起我在二十多年前，我在交大读书的时候啊，我们那时候是我们发起的一个请愿，向校领导请愿。

translation: For what?
transcript: 请愿什么？

translation: We demanded not to turn off the lights too early at eleven o’clock in the evening and we wanted to study all night, so that we had such a petition.
transcript: 说晚上你不应该太早熄灯，十一点就把灯熄掉了，我们要要学习，你应该通宵开灯，以至于我们要去请愿。

translation: But now college students will choose to pay 20 yuan rather than attend classes by themselves.
transcript: 但现在的大学生已经说，我给你二十块钱你去帮我上课。

translation: I often discuss it with my colleagues that why do students behave in such way?
transcript: 我问一些大学老师我们经常在交流，我说同学们为什么要这么做？

translation: Someone answered: “Because they want to sleep during the day.”
transcript: 他说：“他们因为白天想睡觉。”

translation: I wondered why they sleep during the day.
transcript: 我说：“为什么白天要睡觉啊？”

translation: Then replied that “Because they play games at night.”
transcript: 他说：“因为晚上要打游戏。”

translation: It’s terrible indeed.
transcript: 哦，我说这个terrible，非常可怕。

translation: But what’s worse？
transcript: 但是更可怕的事情是什么？

translation: Those who spent 20 yuan asking others to attend classes instead are not necessarily less successful than his classmates who attend the class regularly.
transcript: 我觉得是这些花了二十块钱，请人去帮他签到的同学啊，他将来混的不见得比你差，他的出路不见得比你规规矩矩上课的同学差。

translation: It is more terrible.
transcript: 这个是更可怕的。

translation: What does it mean?
transcript: 这说明什么？

translation: It shows that in the university, the classes might not offer students enough useful knowledge.
transcript: 这说明我们的大学课堂里边，不见得能够给同学们足够有用的知识。

translation: This is the education aiming for a diploma, and many of us study out of this reason.
transcript: 这是一张文凭，我们很多人，都为了一张文凭去学习。

translation: Among over 2,000 universities I mentioned earlier.
transcript: 我前面谈到的我们两千多所大学当中。

translation: I estimate that more than 80% also aim merely for diploma education as they provide it.
transcript: 我估计可能80%以上，它也只是为了文凭而教学的，因为它提供文凭。

translation: But what is the essence of a diploma?
transcript: 但是文凭它的本质是什么？

translation: It is essentially generated by the age of information asymmetry.
transcript: 文凭本质上它是信息不对称的时代的产物。

translation: For instance, because I don’t know you and your ability as well, so I would rather believe this diploma.
transcript: 因为我不认识你，因为我不了解你的能力，所以我宁愿相信这张文凭。

translation: You graduated from a certain university.
transcript: 你是这个学校毕业的。

translation: You had four years of undergraduate education or graduate education,
transcript: 你是受过四年本科教育的，你是受过研究生教育的。

translation: All depend on a piece of paper to prove your ability.
transcript: 靠这一张纸来证明你的能力。

translation: Because I don’t have enough time or enough data to know more about you.
transcript: 因为我没有足够多的时间去了解你，因为我没有足够多的数据和历史去了解你。

translation: In that way, we can say diploma is the product of information asymmetry era.
transcript: 所以文凭是信息不对称时代的产物。

translation: However, in the next five years, maybe ten years, maybe at most one or two decades.
transcript: 但是，我想在接下去的也许五年，也许十年，顶多就一二十年的时间之内。

translation: As Internet teaching, mobile learning, ubiquitous learning and big data in education develop or become highly available.
transcript: 随着互联网教学，随着移动学习，随着泛在学习，随着教育大数据的发展，随着它应用得越来越广。

translation: Then every education experience, every exam, every question that be handled, every project and how well each project do can be all recorded.
transcript: 当一个记录你每一次学历，每一次考试，每一次答疑，每一个project。

translation: When an HR faces such data and a diploma, what will win more favors?
transcript: 每个项目做得怎么样了的一个数据和一张文凭同时摆在一个HR面前的时候，他是宁愿相信一个文凭呢还是相信这么一串数据？

translation: So I think that as the Internet is more involved in every aspect of our daily life more rapidly, diplomas will become increasingly meaningless.
transcript: 所以我想，在互联网越来越快地进入我们日常生活方方面面的这么一个时代，文凭将会变得越来越没有意义。

translation: Furthermore, offering diplomas is the only purpose for many universities in China.
transcript: 进一步，我们中国有很多大学它其实只是发文凭的。

translation: Maybe 70% or 80% of them hold that purpose, which will be greatly challenged or finally disappear in the next one or two decades.
transcript: 那么这些大学也许是70%也许是80%，在接下去的一二十年之内它们可能面临巨大的挑战甚至就会被消失掉。

translation: As for teachers in some universities or even in famous ones.
transcript: 而我们的老师，在这么一些大学里边的老师或者说即使是在名牌大学里边。

translation: If you are not open or hard enough and not able to master Internet learning, may encounter same challenges as well.
transcript: 你自己不够开放，不够努力，不够能够驾驭互联网学习的这样一些老师，恐怕也会面临同样颠覆的危险。

translation: So that we can further predict future.
transcript: 我们可以进一步地预测未来。

translation: Secondary schools may become more important than universities, and maybe someday elementary schools will outrivals in importance.
transcript: 中学可能会变得更重要，比大学更重要，也许些到某一天小学也会变得更重要。

translation: At that time, professors, academicians or masters will be no longer mysterious figures as information asymmetry is further broken.
transcript: 而我们现在很多意义上的教授、院士或者说大师，他可能随着信息不对称的进一步被打破，他们将变得不再神秘。

translation: In fact, I personally think that many masters gained such fame because of information asymmetry.
transcript: 其实我个人认为很多大师都是因为由于信息不对称，你才知道他认为他是个大师。

translation: Only a selected few have unique abilities beyond ordinary people.
transcript: 只有极少数的人可能还是有独特的超出凡人的这些能力。

translation: How about famous schools, especially those like Tsinghua University, Peking University, Jiaotong University and Fudan University?
transcript: 名校会怎么样，尤其像清华、北大、交大、复旦这样的名校？

translation: They may evolve into research-oriented universities, or research institutions in the name of universities, whose teaching functions will be increasingly weakened.
transcript: 它们可能会演变为研究型的一些大学，或者说是叫大学名义的研究机构，它们的教学部分的功能将会越来越弱化。

translation: Then what kind of universities can survive?
transcript: 什么样的大学可能会幸存呢？

translation: The answer must be those with an open and ready mind to welcome the Internet Age and with teachers of young mentality.
transcript: 是那些能够有开放的心态面对互联网时代到来的，并且做好准备，并且足够心态年轻的一批青年教师，或者心态年轻的老师构成的学校，它可能会存在。

translation: An little known university may rise to be a star; a diligent but unknown teacher becomes a hit.
transcript: 可能是一个名不见经传的学校，它会变成像明星一样的学校，可能是一个勤奋的名不见经传的老师，他可能变成一个广受欢迎的老师。

translation: Now back to the question why do we need to learn?
transcript: 我们为什么需要学习？

translation: Maybe in another 50 or 100 years, it will become very simple.
transcript: 回头来考虑这个问题，也许再过五十年或者一百年这个问题会变得非常简单。

translation: Why?
transcript: 为什么需要学习？

translation: We should learn because knowledge cannot be inherited.
transcript: 学习是因为我们的知识不能被遗传。

translation: Imagine that if knowledge can be inherited, we may not need to learn.
transcript: 想象如果知识能够被遗传的话我们也许就不需要学习了。

translation: Will it become true?
transcript: 但知识可能被遗传吗？

translation: I think it’s possible.
transcript: 我觉得是有可能的。

translation: Of course, maybe one day when our brains can be implanted with a chip, knowledge then can be inherited.
transcript: 当然在某一天，我们大脑可以植入一个芯片的时候，那个时候知识可能就被会遗传了。

translation: Then schools will be greatly divergent from what they are now.
transcript: 然后我们可能学校和现在是完全不一样。

translation: Totally different.
transcript: 附机会是一个翻天覆地的变化。

translation: Lots of them will no longer exist.
transcript: 很多的学校基粉基本上就不会存在啦。

translation: So what should we do at that time?
transcript: 但那个时候，我们该做什么呢？

translation: In my opinion, knowledge may be inherited and copied, but our personality, emotions, love and humanity, all of which makes us human, will become more and more significant.
transcript: 我觉得知识也许可以被遗传，可以被拷贝，但是我们个性的东西，我们的情感，我们的爱，我们这一些充满人文情怀的个性，将会变得越来越重要。

translation: Thus, such an era is just around the corner.
transcript: 所以这个时代也许很快就会到来。

translation: Be a man of distinct character, be a man of strong will, be yourself.
transcript: 作为一个有个性的你，作为一个坚强的你，Be yourself。

translation: That might be the future of our education.
transcript: 可能是我们教育的未来。

translation: Thank you!
transcript: 谢谢！
